relation: There are no places to dine on campus but there are a variety of places around the campus that are very close. mainly fast food but there are also a variety of restaurants to dine at as well.

Academic rigor is at a moderate level. the best thing is that if you do have trouble they have various ways to get help with the course your taking and the teacher are absolutely willing to help in any way possible.

My tips for prospective student is to apply as early as possible and apply for financial aid as soon as possible because classes fill up very fast. and to take the classes very seriously especially if you plan to transfer as i do.

central piedmont is a very good school. i plan on attending in the fall semester, and was blown away by the excellent service and the positive attitudes of all the staff i encountered. The overall environment of the campus in amazing as well. on a beautiful day the campus will definitely enlighten your mood.
pageTitle: Central Piedmont Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {180626=I am enjoying my time at CPCC. It's a good value for the money, and I believe ranked second best nationwide, at some point? There is an art festival every April that draws community figures, and other events throughout the year, as well., 269137=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 4120=community college tution is the same as all community colleges in the area so about $1200 for 5 3-classes. not including books., 3090=4 out of 5 campuses are completely safe. central however is in downtown charlotte, combine that with night classes and the need for some students to carry around laptops, smart phones, ipods, and other expensive gadgets. results in about one mugging every other month, which isn't that bad considering their are 70,000 students at cpcc as of spring 2012., 6473=cpcc is great, with small classes, two free gyms, and classes on every subject i've ever heard of. the staff are always helpful and informative. they offer classes to fit your schedule from 8:30 am to 10:00 pm m-f and online. and with five campuses it is convenunt travel wise.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Adam from Concord, NC 01/27/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 2 of 65 Categories Comments Campus Safety 4 out of 5 campuses are completely safe. central however is in downtown charlotte, combine that with night classes and the need for some students to carry around laptops, smart phones, ipods, and other expensive gadgets. results in about one mugging every other month, which isn't that bad considering their are 70,000 students at cpcc as of spring 2012. Great for these types of students anyone who likes to have no more than 34 students in a class. and/or needs to take classes for work, their own enrichment, an associates degree, or to transfer to a four-year university. Bang for the buck community college tution is the same as all community colleges in the area so about $1200 for 5 3-classes. not including books.
